certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt1: To create a certificate signing request, provide the information below:
certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt2: Country - The country the certificate will be used in. Use a two-letter code according to the ISO 3166 standard. For example, the code for the United States is US. For the full list of country codes, go to the web site of the International Organization for Standardization.
certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt3: State or province - The local administrative region.
certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt5: Organization - The name of the organization to which the entity identified in Common Name belongs.
certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt6: Organizational Unit - The name of the organizational unit to which the entity identified in Common Name belongs.
certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt7: Common Name - Denotes the name of the person or other entity that the certificate identifies.
certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt8: Click OK to create the request. The request is created in PEM format and can be saved to a file and sent to a Certificate Authority (CA).
certificates_create_request_h.helpTxt8-1: Click OK to create the request, the request is created in PEM format. Copy and paste the text in an editor and save to a file. This file can be sent to a Certificate Authority (CA).

certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt1: To create a self-signed certificate, provide the information below:
certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt2: Certificate ID - Unique name to identify the certificate. Use maximum 32 characters.
certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt3: Expires on - Year, month and day when the certificate expires.
certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt4: Country - The country the certificate will be used in. Use a two-letter code according to the ISO 3166 standard. For example, the code for the United States is US. For the full list of country codes, go to the web site of the International Organization for Standardization.
certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt5: State or province - The local administrative region.
certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt7: Organization - The name of the organization to which the entity identified in Common Name belongs.
certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt8: Organizational Unit - The name of the organizational unit to which the entity identified in Common Name belongs.
certificates_create_selfsigned_h.helpTxt9: Common Name - Denotes the name of the person or other entity that the certificate identifies.

certificates_h.help1Txt1: Certificates are used to authenticate devices on a network. Two types of certificates can be used with the Axis product:
certificates_h.help1Txt2: Server/Client certificates validate the identity of the Axis product.
certificates_h.help1Txt3: CA certificates authenticate peer certificates, for example a certificate of an authentication server in case the Axis product is connected to an IEEE 802.1X protected network.
certificates_h.help1Txt4: Note: All certificates, except preinstalled CA certificates, will be deleted if the product is reset to factory default. Preinstalled CA certificates that have been deleted will be reinstalled.
certificates_h.help2Txt1: A Server/Client certificate identifies the Axis product. The certificate can be self-signed or issued by a Certificate Authority (CA). A self-signed certificate offers limited protection and can be used before a CA-issued certificate has been obtained.
certificates_h.help2Txt2: To install a self-signed certificate, click Create self-signed certificate and provide the requested information.
certificates_h.help2Txt3: To obtain a signed certificate from an issuing Certificate Authority (CA), select a self-signed certificate, click Create certificate signing request and provide the requested information.
certificates_h.help2Txt4: Note: To create a certificate signing request, a self-signed certificate must first be created.
certificates_h.help2Txt5: When the request is complete, copy the PEM-formatted request and send to the selected CA.
certificates_h.help2Txt6: When the signed certificate is returned, click Install certificate to import the certificate.
certificates_h.help3Txt1: To view the properties for an installed certificate, select the certificate and click Properties.
certificates_h.help3Txt2: To delete a certificate, select the certificate and click Delete.
certificates_h.help4Txt1: A CA certificate is used to authenticate a peer certificate, for example to validate the identity of an authentication server in case the Axis product is connected to an IEEE 802.1X protected network.
certificates_h.help4Txt2: The Axis product has several preinstalled CA certificates. If required, additional certificates can be installed by clicking Install certificate.
certificates_h.help4Txt3: To view the properties for an installed certificate, select the certificate and click Properties.
certificates_h.help4Txt4: To delete a certificate, select the certificate and click Delete.

certificates_install_ca_h.help1Txt1: To upload a CA certificate, click Browse and locate the certificate.
certificates_install_ca_h.help1Txt2: Optionally, enter a unique name for the certificate in the Certificate Id field.

certificates_install_h.help1Txt1: Select Certificate from signing request to install a signed certificate returned from the CA.
certificates_install_h.help1Txt2: Optionally, enter a unique name for the certificate in the Certificate Id field.
certificates_install_h.help1Txt3: To upload the signed certificate, click Browse and locate the certificate.
certificates_install_h.help2Txt1: Select Certificate and private key to install a certificate and a private key. Private keys need to be in a PKCS#1 format in order to function when installing Certificates.
certificates_install_h.help2Txt2: If the private key is to be uploaded in a separate file, select Use separate private key. To upload the private key, click Browse and locate the key.
certificates_install_h.help2Txt3: PKCS#12 is a cryptography standard. If the certificate is in PKCS#12 format, select PKCS#12 and enter the password.
certificates_install_h.help2Txt4: Optionally, enter a unique name for the certificate in the Certificate Id field.
certificates_install_h.help2Txt5: To upload the certificate, click Browse and locate the certificate.
